Abstract: combining three-dimensional video analysis ofmating behavior with life history data from natural populations we estimated H. shoshone critical density

Authors: Silva-Briano, M; Suárez-Morales, E; Ortiz, AA; Reyes-Flores, M
Article Title: Two species of Mastigodiaptomus (Copepoda: Diaptomidae), hosts of the epibiotic ciliate Trichodina diaptomi (Peritricha) in North America
Abstract: identifying T.diaptomi from a sample from mexico

Authors: Kasalicky, V; Jezbera, J; Simek, K; Hahn, MW
Article Title: Limnohabitans planktonicus sp nov and Limnohabitans parvus sp nov., planktonic betaproteobacteria isolated from a freshwater reservoir, and emended description of the genus Limnohabitans
Source Title: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY
Abstract: Two bacterial strains, II-B4T and II-D5T, isolated from the meso-eutrophic freshwater Římov reservoir (Czech Republic), were characterized phenotypically

Authors: Mano, H; Sakamoto, M; Tanaka, Y
Article Title: A comparative study of insecticide toxicity among seven cladoceran species
Abstract: The sensitivities of seven cladoceran species (Ceriodaphnia reticulata, Chydorus sphaericus, Daphnia galeata, Diaphanosoma brachyurum, Moina macrocopa, Scapholeberis kingi, and Simocephalus vetulus) to carbamate insecticides (carbaryl and methomyl) were investigated by acute toxicity tests

Authors: Yin, XW; Liu, PF; Zhu, SS; Chen, XX
Article Title: Food selectivity of the herbivore Daphnia magna (Cladocera) and its impact on competition outcome between two freshwater green algae
Abstract: does otimal foraging theory lead to lead to small-sized Chlorella becoming a superior competitor in the presence of Daphnia.

Authors: Rojo, C; Salazar, G
Article Title: Why are there so many kinds of planktonic consumers? The answer lies in the allometric diet breadth
Abstract: apply the ADBM to infer the feeding linkages within a freshwater planktonic community of a Spanish oligo-mesotrophic lake and three spatial partitions of it

Authors: Hahn, MW; Kasalicky, V; Jezbera, J; Brandt, U; Jezberová, J; Simek, K
Article Title: Limnohabitans curvus gen. nov., sp nov., a planktonic bacterium isolated from a freshwater lake
Source Title: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY
Abstract: strain, MWH-C5T, isolated from the water column of the oligomesotrophic Lake Mondsee (Austria), was characterized phenotypically, phylogenetically and chemotaxonomically

Authors: Sakamoto, M; Hanazato, T; Tanaka, Y
Article Title: Impact of an Insecticide on Persistence of Inherent Antipredator Morphology of a Small Cladoceran, Bosmina
Source Title: ARCHIVES OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION AND TOXICOLOGY
Abstract: assessed the impacts of an insecticide, carbaryl, on the life-history parameters of a polymorphic cladoceran, Bosmina longirostris, and on Bosmina–copepod interaction

Authors: Ki, JS; Cho, SY; Katano, T; Jung, SW; Lee, J; Park, BS; Kang, SH; Han, MS
Article Title: Comprehensive comparisons of three pennate diatoms, Diatoma tenuae, Fragilaria vaucheriae, and Navicula pelliculosa, isolated from summer Arctic reservoirs (Svalbard 79A°N), by fine-scale morphology and nuclear 18S ribosomal DNA
Abstract: report morphological and molecular characteristics of dominant freshwater diatoms in summer Arctic reservoirs of Svalbard (Norway)

Authors: Matthews, B; Mazumder, A
Article Title: Detecting trophic-level variation in consumer assemblages
Abstract: We examined the sources of variation in zooplankton ΔN by measuring the trophic enrichment (ΔN) of seven species of freshwater cladocerans, and by testing for an effect of age and temperature on the ΔN of Daphnia pulicaria

Authors: Rowe, CL; Adamowicz, SJ; Hebert, PDN
Article Title: Three new cryptic species of the freshwater zooplankton genus Holopedium (Crustacea: Branchiopoda: Ctenopoda), revealed by genetic methods
Abstract: Here, we provide the first large-scale examination of taxonomic diversity in the genus Holopedium

Authors: Sigee, DC; Bahram, F; Estrada, B; Webster, RE; Dean, AP
Article Title: The influence of phosphorus availability on carbon allocation and P quota in Scenedesmus subspicatus:: A synchrotron-based FTIR analysis
Abstract: Synchrotron-based Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) microspectroscopy was used to characterise the molecular composition of the freshwater alga Scenedesmus subspicatus, cultured at three different initial concentrations of phosphorus

Authors: Pannard, A; Bormans, M; Lefebvre, S; Claquin, P; Lagadeuc, Y
Article Title: Phytoplankton size distribution and community structure: influence of nutrient input and sedimentary loss
Abstract: examines the effects of nutrient availability and sedimentary loss on the dynamics of freshwater phytoplankton, from the physiological state at the cellular level to the competition issue at the community level

Authors: Jezberová, J; Komárková, J
Article Title: Morphometry and growth of three Synechococcus-like picoplanktic cyanobacteria at different culture conditions
Abstract: Three phycocyanin-rich strains of Synechococcus-like picoplanktic cyanobacteria, isolated from the plankton of Czech oligotrophic to eutrophic freshwater reservoirs, were investigated in crossed gradients of light and temperature and in combination with two different culture media (BG-11 and WC)

Authors: Bittencourt-Oliveira, MD; Moura, AD; Gouvea-Barros, S; Pinto, E
Article Title: HIP1 DNA fingerprinting in Microcystis panniformis (Chroococcales, Cyanobacteria)
Abstract: explores genetic diversity among 14 strains of M. panniformis isolated from 4 freshwater reservoirs in 2 different Brazilian regions

Authors: Weisse, T; Stadler, P
Article Title: Effect of pH on growth, cell volume, and production of freshwater ciliates, and implications for their distribution
Abstract: We investigated the effect of pH on growth, cell volume, and production of the freshwater ciliates Urotrichafarcta, U. furcata, and U. castalia

Authors: Passarge, J; Hol, S; Escher, M; Huisman, J
Article Title: Competition for nutrients and light: Stable coexistence, alternative stable states, or competitive exclusion?
Abstract: nvestigation of competition among phytoplankton species

Authors: Kuczynska-Kippen, N
Article Title: On body size and habitat selection in rotifers in a macrophye-dominated lake Budzynskie, Poland
Abstract: Measuring the difference in rotifer densities in different locations of a lake

Authors: Hawkins, PR; Holliday, J; Kathuria, A; Bowling, L
Article Title: Change in cyanobacterial biovolume due to preservation by Lugol's Iodine
Abstract: Change in cyanobacterial biovolume due to preservation by Lugol's Iodine

Authors: Jankowski, T; Strauss, T; Ratte, HT
Article Title: Trophic interactions of the freshwater jellyfish Craspedacusta sowerbii
Abstract: The predatory impact and the trophic role of the freshwater jellyfish, Craspedacusta sowerbii, was studied using microcosm and enclosure experiments as well as a 3-year pond survey

Authors: Peña-Castro, JM; Martínez-Jerónimo, F; Esparza-García, F; Cañizares-Villanueva, RO
Article Title: Phenotypic plasticity in Scenedesmus incrassatulus (Chlorophyceae) in response to heavy metals stress
Abstract: phenotypic plasticity of Scenedesmus incrassatulus (a non-spiny, four-cell coenobium forming species) in response to EC50 value of copper, cadmium and hexavalent chromium

Authors: Boenigk, J; Stadler, P; Wiedlroither, A; Hahn, MW
Article Title: Strain-specific differences in the grazing sensitivities of closely related ultramicrobacteria affiliated with the Polynucleobacter cluster
Abstract: investigated the sensitivity of ultramicrobacteria affiliated with the cosmopolitan Polynucleobacter cluster to grazing by Spumella-like nanoflagellates.

Authors: Mueller, CR; Eversole, AG; Turker, H; Brune, DE
Article Title: Effect of silver carp Hypophthalmichthys molitrix and freshwater mussel Elliptio complanata filtration on the phytoplankton community of Partitioned Aquaculture System units
Source Title: JOURNAL OF THE WORLD AQUACULTURE SOCIETY
Abstract: examine the phytoplankton in PAS waters that were stocked with silver carp and mussles

Authors: Carotenuto, Y; Lampert, W
Article Title: Ingestion and incorporation of freshwater diatoms by Daphnia pulicaria:: do morphology and oxylipin production matter?
Abstract: In order to explain differences in the growth and reproduction of Daphnia pulicaria fed various freshwater diatoms, we measured ingestion rates and carbon incorporation for six cultured diatom species

Authors: Lemke, AM; Stoeckel, JA; Pegg, MA
Article Title: Utilization of the exotic cladoceran Daphnia lumholtzi by juvenile fishes in an Illinois River floodplain lake
Abstract: quantify the utilization of D.lumholtzi by juvenile fishes

Authors: Mages, M; Woelfl, S; von Tümpling, W
Article Title: A method for trace element determination of single Daphnia specimens using total reflection X-ray fluorescence spectrometry
Abstract: Two new preparation techniques for total-reflection X-ray fluorescence (TXRF) element determination of single freshwater crustacean specimens (dry weight: 3–40 μg ind−1) have been developed and tested using Daphnia pulex

Authors: Jahan, N; Alam, MGM; Sugiura, N; Norman, CP; Maekawa, T
Article Title: Seasonal variation in frequency of dividing cells of freshwater phytoplankters
Abstract: Measured the frequency of dividiung cells of phytoplankton seasonally

Authors: Gosselain, V; Hamilton, PB; Descy, JP
Article Title: Estimating phytoplankton carbon from microscopic counts: an application for riverine systems
Abstract: we focus on the way to convert biovolume to carbon biomass for algal assemblages of two rivers, using a computerized system that records dimensions of phytoplankton

Authors: Cecchine, G; Snell, TW
Article Title: Toxicant exposure increases threshold food levels in freshwater rotifer populations
Abstract: effect of food limitiation on rotifer sinsitivity to toxicants

Authors: Dudycha, JL; Tessier, AJ
Article Title: Natural genetic variation of life span, reproduction, and juvenile growth in Daphnia
Abstract: high extrinsic mortality in natural populations shouldselect for accelerated reproductive investment and shortened life span

Authors: Pfister, G; Sonntag, B; Posch, T
Article Title: Comparison of a direct live count and an improved quantitative protargol stain (QPS) in determining abundance and cell volumes of pelagic freshwater protozoa
Abstract: A direct live count and a routinely applicable modification of a quantitative protargol stain (QPS) were evaluated with respect to their reliability in determining and quantifying pelagic freshwater ciliates and heterotrophic and mixotrophic flagellates.

Authors: Twombly, S; Clancy, N; Burns, CW
Article Title: Life history consequences of food quality in the freshwater copepod Boeckella triarticulata
Abstract: measured several life history traitson a large number of individuals to document the effects of food quality on individualtraits, on life history correlates, and on a composite measure of individual ﬁtness in thefreshwater copepod Boeckella triarticulata

Authors: Kawabata, K; Urabe, J
Article Title: Length-weight relationships of eight freshwater planktonic crustacean species in Japan
Abstract: The relationships between body length and dry weight were examined for eight species of freshwater planktonic crustacea common in Japan

Authors: Ryan, SM; Dodson, SI
Article Title: Seasonal analysis of Daphnia pulicaria swimming behavior
Abstract: individual swimming behavior of Daphnia pulicaria over a yearly cycle in a temperate lake

Authors: Telesh, IV; Rahkola, M; Viljanen, M
Article Title: Carbon content of some freshwater rotifers
Abstract: Carbon content of rotifers from 14 species was determined with the high temperature combustion method of Salonen

Authors: Weisse, T; Kirchhoff, B
Article Title: Feeding of the heterotrophic freshwater dinoflagellate Peridiniopsis berolinense on cryptophytes: Analysis by flow cytometry and electronic particle counting
Abstract:
e measured feeding rates and food select~vlty of the heterotrophic freshwater dinoflagellate Peridiniopsis berolinense by analytic flow cytometry (AFC), electronic particle counting and
sizing (EPCS), and conventional microscopy.

Authors: Macek, M; Simek, K; Pernthaler, J; Vyhnalek, V; Psenner, R
Article Title: Growth rates of dominant planktonic ciliates in two freshwater bodies of different trophic degree
Abstract: The in situ growth rates of dominant ciliate species were studied during and shortly after phytoplankton peaks in two water bodies

Authors: HART, RC; JARVIS, AC
Article Title: INSITU DETERMINATIONS OF BACTERIAL SELECTIVITY AND FILTRATION-RATES BY 5 CLADOCERAN ZOOPLANKTERS IN A HYPERTROPHIC SUBTROPICAL RESERVOIR
Abstract: Cladoceran in situ feeding rates on natural bacteria labelled with [methyl-3H] were studied

Authors: MULLER, H; GELLER, W
Article Title: MAXIMUM GROWTH-RATES OF AQUATIC CILIATED PROTOZOA - THE DEPENDENCE ON BODY SIZE AND TEMPERATURE RECONSIDERED
Abstract: Measuring maximum growth rates of freshwater cilliates

Authors: VAQUE, D; PACE, ML
Article Title: GRAZING ON BACTERIA BY FLAGELLATES AND CLADOCERANS IN LAKES OF CONTRASTING FOOD-WEB STRUCTURE
Abstract: tested the hypothesis that grazing on bacteria would vary between lakes with differing plankton community structures

Authors: SHERR, EB; SHERR, BF; BERMAN, T; HADAS, O
Article Title: HIGH ABUNDANCE OF PICOPLANKTON-INGESTING CILIATES DURING LATE FALL IN LAKE KINNERET, ISRAEL
Abstract: composition of lake kinneret

Authors: MACISAAC, HJ; GILBERT, JJ
Article Title: DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN EXPLOITATIVE AND INTERFERENCE COMPETITION BETWEEN CLADOCERA AND KERATELLA-COCHLEARIS
Abstract: assessed the relative extent by which small- and large-bodied cladocerans suppressed the rotifer Keratella cochlearis by t

Authors: CHOWFRASER, P; MALY, EJ
Article Title: FACTORS GOVERNING CLUTCH SIZE IN 2 SPECIES OF DIAPTOMUS (COPEPODA, CALANOIDA)
Source Title: CANADIAN JOURNAL OF FISHERIES AND AQUATIC SCIENCES
Abstract: conducted a synoptic survey of 1 1 wonstratifying lakes in eastern Quebec to investigate the relative importance of water temperature, food concentration ([Chi a]), female prosome length, copepod density (population and community densities), and mate availability (sex ratio and density of males) in determining the clutch size of two freshwater copepods, Biaptsmus minutus and B. sregsasensis

Authors: GIANI, A
Article Title: IMPLICATIONS OF PHYTOPLANKTON CHEMICAL-COMPOSITION FOR ZOOPLANKTON PRODUCTION - EXPERIMENTAL-EVIDENCE
Abstract: Growth and reproduction of two Daphnia species (Cladocera) from Lake Constance were measured experimentally in a through-flow laboratory system under different food conditions, in order to investigate the effect of food quality on zooplankton populations

Authors: ROCHA, O; DUNCAN, A
Article Title: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN CELL CARBON AND CELL-VOLUME IN FRESH-WATER ALGAL SPECIES USED IN ZOOPLANKTONIC STUDIES
Abstract: New records of cell carbon and cell volume are given for five species of freshwater algae cultured optimally for use in physiological studies on Daphnia spp.

Authors: SMITH, REH; KALFF, J
Article Title: COMPETITION FOR PHOSPHORUS AMONG CO-OCCURRING FRESH-WATER PHYTOPLANKTON
Abstract: Competition at different levels of phosphorus availability was observed in continuous cultures of freshwater phytoplankton communities
